headline.main: These Stairs Were Made for Walking

docs.abstract: With green signs bearing the slogan, "Burn calories, not electricity," New York City is fighting obesity and global warming by encouraging people to take the stairs.
docs.lead_paragraph: City officials seem awfully meddlesome with our weight these days. First Philadelphia challenged its residents to lose 76 tons in 76 days. Then Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg thought it was a good idea to remind us how many calories we consume each time we go to Starbucks.
docs.snippet: With green signs bearing the slogan, "Burn calories, not electricity," New York City is fighting obesity and global warming by encouraging people to take the stairs.

headline.seo: Eating Junk Food May Help Stressed-Out Monkeys Cope

docs.lead_paragraph: New research suggests that eating fatty snacks may be a coping strategy for low-status primates.
docs.snippet: New research suggests that eating fatty snacks may be a coping strategy for low-status primates.

headline.main: The Early Word: Obama Holding Off on Declaring Win

docs.abstract: Barack Obama's campaign said it won't make a big declaration of victory on Tuesday night, even though he's likely to earn the votes needed to give him a majority of pledged delegates.
docs.lead_paragraph: Barack Obama and his family greeted a record-breaking crowd of 75,000 in Portland, Ore., on Sunday, ahead of that state's primary this Tuesday. Even if things "go as we hope," he said, his campaign won't declare victory in the Democratic primary that night, even though Oregon could tip the majority of pledged delegates his way.
docs.snippet: Barack Obama's campaign said it won't make a big declaration of victory on Tuesday night, even though he's likely to earn the votes needed to give him a majority of pledged delegates.

headline.print_headline: For an All-Organic Formula, Baby, That’s Sweet
headline.main: For an All-Organic Formula, Baby, That’s Sweet

docs.lead_paragraph: A popular organic infant formula is sweetened with cane sugar, which babies may prefer but pediatricians do not.
docs.snippet: A popular organic infant formula is sweetened with cane sugar, which babies may prefer but pediatricians do not.
